text: pc error 0x8007139f fixed hey all  i was having a ton of issues with this error with being unable to install updates to games or install new games on my pc via the  app  but it looks like they finally fixed it  looks like you need to run powershell as an admin and then follow these instructions  then try updating gaming services again and it should work  at least it did for me :  try reinstalling the gaming services package on your windows  device:   right-click the start button  in the lower-left corner of the main screen  and then select windows powershell  admin     in the administrator: windows powershell screen  type the following command and press enter:get-appxpackage \gamingservices\ -allusers | remove-appxpackage -allusers

text: repair/replace dilemma tl;dr — should i repair my malfunctioning  one s or upgrade  so i m in a bit of a pickle with my  one s and i m not sure what to do  i bought it back in  to be a 4k home theater hub with some casual gaming  and it worked great for a long time  late last year i started having issues with it  and i m fairly certain the hard drive has gone bad  it ll run well for a few days or sometimes weeks  then i ll have to reset it to factory settings  which admittedly doesn t take that long  but it is annoying   i got an external ssd so i don t have to redownload my games every time  and a fire cube for the family for streaming  so i ve been able to stumble along like that for a few months  here s the dilemma — i want to fix this  but none of the options are perfect  here s what i think my options are:   do nothing  and keep restoring the  every other time i want to play fallout  until the whole thing dies   spend $ for the microsoft repair or replace  which means spending $ on a nearly five-year-old system    spend $ on the  series s  but lose the ability to play dvds  blu-rays  hd-dvds and older games i own on disc  some of which i ve never opened    try to buy the $  series x  which has more gaming power than this casual gamer will ever need  and which will stick out like a sore thumb on my shelf  basically just for the disc drive i m also trying to figure out how much it would cost to buy digital versions of all my physical games  but i hate the notion of having to rebuy what i already own  so  any thoughts from the community  i appreciate your feedback

text: some info for those that keep asking this is a post of my comment for  users help  alot of people keep posting questions that are answered here  the series this is a great console just know that all series games needs that be on the internal or the expansion slot otherwise all your one games can be installed on a external hdd there are three kinds of memory nvme ssd ssd hdd series games have to be played on an nvme ssd series consoles internal is an nvme ssd the expansion slot in the back is a pcie4 slot  it is possible to third party a lot for that but i know there s some work involved   i don t recommend trying this because i don t believe it s plug and play easy like most users want until they release third party nvme ssds for the consoles also in your games library go to sort your games by console type of sort by what consoles play them and alphabetize at the same time and you ll see which ones need to be installed on what drives hope this hel cheers 🥂

text: details on project cobalt and project indus - windows central   i first heard about indus back in  spring   although was only able to confirm that the project is  definitely going ahead  thanks to the geforce leak  project indus is a  4x strategy game being developed by oxide games  known for its work on  real-time strategy  rts  title  ashes of the singularity       although  indus  unique hook remains to be seen  the gameplay sounds very similar  to what you experience in civilization  with turn-based strategic  elements alongside city building  empire advancement  espionage   diplomacy  warfare  and so on  from what i understand  indus is indeed  targeting pc    and steam         as  teased by inxile entertainment itself on twitter  the wasteland studio  is working on a new f rpg  although details remain shrouded in  mystery       what we do know is that  it s codenamed cobalt  and believe it has a steampunk-style  inspired by  industrial revolution-inspired tech  expect steam engines  zeppelins   retro-futuristic robots  dark victorian-era streets  and more  the above  concept art was shared by inxile concept artist aleksander danilovac  on artstation  and we have reason to believe this is representative of  the environmental style inxile is gunning to deliver    link :

everything feels slow compared to my xsx  this is not even some desperate plea to get the blades os back  i m not even bothered what it looks like  that said i ve seen some absolute 🔥 🔥 🔥 designs on the internet that would be awesome  but genuinely i d be happy with a very simple looking design just as long as it sped the system up  there are also many things that don t need to be in there text: i implore not a single soul support turtle beach  especially their stealth  s v2 to start off one of the most frustrating aspects is every  hours or so they ll decide to stop registering mic inputs entirely and it ll basically register like you don t have a mic on your headset of course this is only fixed with an entire hard restart of your system  than on top of that the bluetooth/wireless capability connectivity both are absolute garbage from no joke  feet away i regularly have my mic disconnect from the  entirely like i ve gone out of range and it ll require and entire restart just to get it to attempt to connect again  than on top of that if you use the bluetooth feature while playing  you know the whole purpose of it it ll regularly cut to what i like to call robot voice mode where everything that comes through that bluetooth channels sounds extremely distorted/like a google translator  than if the connectivity issues where not enough it s got a fake surround sound  the headset only has  50mm speakers and it gives the illusion of surround sound via digital profiles this can be good enough for basic left right distinctions which is sufficient for say call of duty  but the moment you play a vertical game like splitgate you re lost if someones coming from below or above you because all you ve got is a very clear left right distinction   finally on top of all of this if you dare turn on your headset while the wrong account is signed in the mic features is locked to that account if you switch you can join on both accounts but if you dare sign expected from a walmart owned and operated company  i just implore you go with a different pair of headphones  i assume any brand would be better than these especially at $   btw every pair of turtle beaches sports the exact same 50mm bullshit fake surround sound speaker set up that isn t nearly comparable to the real thing when gaming

text: i’ve had two series x controllers start to have the same issues after a few months of purchasing them the first one i bought back in november  from amazon  all black controller   and the second was from walmart in june   blue and white controller   the first controller was fine up until june  then it began to have a bunch of different issues  - the left thumb stick would rarely register input when i moved it up  so i’d have to use the d-pad to register an upward input or click the stick in while facing it up so it would register - the left thumb stick and d-pad would register double inputs  so if i tapped or moved them at all in menus my selection would move over twice - the a button often wouldn’t register  - both sticks had a bit of drift  so due to all of these issues that i couldn’t find a fix for  i just purchased another one  this time i picked up the blue and white controller and it worked great until a week or so ago  suddenly it started to sometimes not register an upward thumb stick movement  this didn’t happen often but over the past week this has gotten worse and worse and now most of the time it won’t register upward input  then all of the other issues my last controller had started to pop up  and now it’s in pretty much the same state the first one was   i don’t throw my controllers at the wall or abuse them or anything  i’ve kept food away from them and made sure they stay clean so it shouldn’t be an issue of intentional misuse unless i’m somehow doing something to them that i don’t realize  multiple people in my household use it so it gets a lot of use  but i’ve never had controllers go out like this after only a few months   is there anything i should try to fix these  i’m hesitant to buy another because  controllers in less than a year is ridiculous and i expect a new one would eventually have the same issues  has anyone else had similar problems

text: i regret buying the  series s i have been a pc gamer my whole life and i have been gaming for about - years minnimum  i m currently rocking a x  3gb gpu and by today s standards it s almost obsolete i can only run the current esports titles well other than that the aaa single player games don t run that well  so what i do is i tried to go the cheap console route so wanted to give the  series s a try thinking  this might suffice for at least - years of gaming  looking at the specs i was first shocked like how can a system that is speced so low even remotely handle today s games  so i still bought it since i didn t want to cash in $ for it s counterparts  which might have been a mistake  the first time i launched it i was at awe but the problems started slowly but surely start appearing  i quickly realised the low textured assets for some reason and most of all almost any game that released for the previous generation ran at 900p which took me a bit off there were games like doom and doom eternal that ran better in my pc itself  i even tried forza horizon  and even the game that s series s/x optimised had a lot of pixeled assets and sometimes felt the resolution lowered which was kind of a bummer  the biggest thing of all  the price  i quickly realised that owning the console was actually costing me much more that what i had using a pc  the lacking of the disk drive is also a big problem that people don t address much since you can get games much cheaper on the disk and trade them too  all in all i would say from a pc gamer s perspective i think this is a good console if you travel a lot or just want to chill playing casual games or want to get a quick gaming session but i wouldn t recommend you getting this as your daily driver and if you can afford it pls cash in a bit more cash and get the series x or the  instaid

text: followup: my genuine thoughts/rating on each game i m currently playing a followup to  where i discussed the games i already finished  kena: bridge of spirits|  / gorgeous but glitchy  i ve run into a ton of game-breaking bugs in the first few hours of gameplay  the combat is fun and surprisingly challenging  the world is very beautiful but very one-note   the areas all look the same to me  the cutscenes are stunning but sadly pre-rendered  so they are  f which is very jarring coming from  f gameplay  personally  i d suggest waiting for a sale  deathloop | / it s fun and mostly bug-free  but it still doesn t feel fully polished  the story feels bare-bones and is difficult to grasp because you have to read backstory emails and letters while being shot at  i love the two main characters though  my biggest complaint is that each time you die  you have to sit through a screen with the message  connecting to game server  which really breaks immersion and makes me feel like i m playing fortnite or some online game  then you have to go through a few menus to keep playing   i prefer the way demon s souls handles this  where you die and  seconds later you re back in the game ready to try again  the tedious delays and menus makes me less eager to jump back in and try again  the last of us: part ii | / i definitely disagree with all the people who say it sucks because of the big spoiler event  it s a beautiful game  but it kind of overwhelmed me and i haven t played for a few months  a lot of gameplay revolves around stealth and i m a kick down the door  come in guns blazing kind of person   so that s not ideal for me  disco elysium: the final cut |     i barely started this one  it seems interesting but the controls for highlighting and selecting things feel a bit wonky  doom eternal | / i loved the first  very fast-paced and energetic  and you feel like a total badass jumping around and killing everyone when you get the hang of it  i was % into the campaign and they did the  upgrade  and your save data doesn t carry over   so that really sucks  i ve tried a few times to start over but i really don t have the energy  it s a shame because i was really into the game before i lost my save data  persona  royal | / what an interesting game  it has so many elements and mechanics going on at once  in a good way  mostly   i was initially turned off by the clunky way your character moves around the world and interacts with things and people   imo  it feels and looks very outdated and unpolished  but combat is fun and addictive  and there s so much to do and explore in the world  the game feels endless  which is a bit daunting to me  i prefer medium-sized  tighter games in general  but this one is super addictive and fun   the only other thing that lowers the score for me is the dialogue  i get that it s a japanese game featuring japanese characters and culture  but it translates awkwardly  more often than not  the dialogue feels cringey  bizarre  or downright confusing  it s definitely an adjustment for those not super in touch with japanese culture  still  i like certain aspects of a lot of characters and some of the humor has made me laugh out loud

text: for those of you who successfully appealed a n account ban due to fraud activity/chargeback how did you manage to do it    long story short  my n account was hacked  years ago by someone i did not know nor authorize and despite the obvious fraudulent activity that occurred  which was even confirmed by the first sony rep i spoke with  sony is still holding my account hostage for the unauthorized amount  $    for the record  the purchases were games  first person shooter and fighting  and content that i had zero interest in playing and would never even consider purchasing    every once in a while i reach out to sony for an appeal and since the time my account was hacked there has been some people who have successfully managed to get their ban lifted  i m hoping those who have would be willing to share to give me hope that there is a chance mine can be overturned as well      i guess the two main reasons why i don t want to give up are these:  i ve had that n account since n was initially launched and have a ton of games  content and game progress tied to it that i cannot otherwise access unless logged into   and i m an old-school mmo/rpg gamer who likes to go back to my old games and see what i was up and what my progress was like at the time for a variety of different reasons     the other thing is  it s an ethical issue  as in  why am i being the one penalized when i trusted my personal information to sony  was vigilant about changing my n pw after the sony breaches and yet i m the one who suffers for some criminal s mischief   sorry  but i just can t accept anymore    thank you for your time  i appreciate it

text: my genuine thoughts/rating on each game i beat on my  uncharted - | / run don t walk  like being inside an action movie  the second and fourth were my favorites but all of them are excellent  life is strange | / cozy  nostalgic vibe with very awkward/cringey dialogue  still  it really got under my skin  excited to play the new one  god of war | / a masterpiece  i wish the map were bigger and more diverse  detroit: become human | / i really enjoyed this game until the ending  which i felt was anti-climactic  being able to experience multiple endings is a cool idea  but it undermines your experience and makes it feel less important   ratchet and clank | / combat is a blast   bright  colorful  and easy  dialogue/writing/characters are not my style  very childish and generally not worth listening to  ratchet and clank: rift apart | / i feel this was way overhyped  the writing is worse than the first  and i experienced a ton of bugs and glitches  graphics felt inconsistent  some things gorgeous  some very basic  and combat is the same as the first with no real improvements  fun and pretty  but i d say buy it on sale  infamous: second son | / incredibly fluid movement and combat  i had a blast with this one  still looks fantastic on   i also enjoyed the writing and characters  immortals: fenyx rising | / i loved the first half of this game  combat is simple but fun  world is gorgeous and fun to traverse  but once you leave the first area  you realize that the rest of the  massive  map is littered with the same four enemy types and activities  a problem with most open-world games   also  puzzles aren t my thing  and there are a lot of them  the dialogue and voice acting was absolutely brutal  i also hated both of the dlc   a real missed opportunity there to expand/enrich the world  spiderman: goty edition | / super smooth  gorgeous virtual rendition of new york  i live in manhattan so it was super cool to see   combat and traversal are a blast  spiderman: miles morales | / a beautiful  if short  game that feels more like dlc for spiderman   ghost of tsushima |  / stunning world to explore with unique and stylish combat  the story and dialogue is good but takes itself very seriously  and definitely could ve used a bit more emotional range and humor  biggest complaint is the same with most open world games: the same repeating activities peppered across an unnecessarily huge map  control |  / unique and interesting world with a rich and layered history  classic letters/audio recordings format but with a cool  bureaucratic twist  combat is great  levitating can be clunky but it s super cool  the environmental destruction is out of this world  ending felt underwhelming  mortal kombat  | / i ve never played a mortal kombat game before and i had a blast with the story mode  really over-the-top and dramatic characters  kind of like warcraft universe in that sense   didn t take itself too seriously at all and i enjoyed the humor and action immensely  demons souls | / stunning and challenging  i hate everything about this type of game yet somehow found it incredible  i m honestly not great at games and had to play each level like  times before beating it  but i found it unspeakably satisfying when i finally did beat a boss  i also love that when you die there s a   second loading screen and you re back   no unnecessary menus or wait times to navigate so you can jump right back into the action  looking at you  deathloop

text: hdr too dim / dark hello  after half a day trying to solve this issue - i am really desperate  so maybe there is someone who already had this issue or have delt with it  when i saw for example   ratchet and clank rift apart  this youtube video on my native app on tv with hdr  same tv used for    i was like   wtf  is that really how it supposed to look      it s so nice and bright  no way i ve got the picture like this  the colors looks so vibrant   i also own the game   there are few old threads about similar problems but nothing really worked for me  tv is samsung q8dn   qe55q8dnatxxh  connected with original  hdmi cable  and i am sure i did not have this problem on  pro  native ap like netflix  youtube etc   looks great  no problem at all here  i ve tried so far:   \- turn off/on hdr while in a game   \- unplug the tv from socket for few minutes   \- tried another hdmi port and cable   \- updated firmware on tv       \- tried another tv mode  yes  i am using game mode normally    \- hdmi uhd color activated for every hdmi slot  tv settings    \- recalibrated hdr on  for like 1000x times  /  / and / - everything  click under  barely visible  = so until the sun disappears    \- turn off 120hz settings  my tv does not support it anyway    \- 4k video transfer rate - auto / - / -  no difference    \- restart  too bad that i don t have an option to try it on another led/oled hdr tv  but there must be something that i am missing probably  or the colors are totally fine and it should be a little bit darker  i will be grateful for every feedback

text: in your opinion  should video games accommodate every gamer possible  most definitely not  design is crucial in gaming especially the gameplay which includes controls  enemy/bosses & level design  without intriguing quality of these design components you end up with formulaic assembly line video games which are released every year  some of my favorite franchises have fallen victim to this accommodation like god of war  red dead redemption   castlevania  grand theft auto and assassin s creed  some of them are not entirely bad downgrades however nowhere the quality they used to be   when you give a game so many difficulty options or microtransactions  you are sacrificing a concept that could have created a new audience  these accommodations affects gaming because when you add several difficulty options  you also dilute the game you re creating  imagine if super mario bros  had difficulty options  what would change  adding invincibility and closing death falls in the levels  then what s the point of playing  just so you can say that you finished it just to lie that you played on the hardest difficulty  it doesn t make sense to me personally   i could go on for days on this topic so i ll continue on anything someone wants to ask about in a civil manner

text: which platinums did you most & least enjoy getting  i see so many articles and videos about the hardest and easiest platinums to get but not necessarily ones that are just fun  for me  i replayed god of war on  a few months ago with no intention of going for the plat however i enjoyed my 2nd playthrough so much that i wanted to do all the extras that i didn t do the first time  it was after freeing the dragons and getting that trophy that i thought getting the platinum will theoretically allow me to see everything the game had to offer and other than ng+ this is definitely a great way to squeeze every bit of gameplay out of gow  the only trophy i felt was a bit  grindy  was the birds but i had picked most of them up during my playthrough anyway   on the flip side one game i did think would be fun to platinum and turned into a complete slog was bioshock remastered  i don t know if its because i set out with the intention of getting the platinum as it would be my 10th and i wanted to replay an old fav to celebrate double figure platinums but this was the opposite of gow  the trophies arnt necessarily bad  other than individual trophies for each difficulty  but they just felt like much more a grind

text: account hacked   system generalted lockout  for contacting support more than once  so my account was hacked and they enabled 2fa to prevent me from getting it back  before you tell me that i should have had it enabled on my account  i didn t even know it existed  i don t play games online  i don t have a credit card on my account  i m a filthy casual  i m not  in the loop  in terms of maintaining my account  i had no idea that this security feature  that i didn t know about  could be weaponized against the account holder if they didn t use it themself  so i tried support chat and the agents immediately disconnected when i told them the issue  like they disconnected so fast that i didn t even get a chance to read their reply  i had to download the transcript just to see that they told me they couldn t access my account before disconnecting  so i called support and finally got a hold of someone  who told me that because this was not the first attempt to contact them  she could not access the account  and that it was locked  it makes no sense  because the reason i m calling back is the other agents were not helpful  all they re doing is locking the account owner out to give the hacker more time with the account  it s the opposite of a security feature  worst of all  nobody could give me a timeframe of how long this  system generated lockout  would work  only that if i continued to call  my account could be suspended  so now i m expected to just idly stand by for an undefined amount of time while this other person has full access to my account  i m floored by how little they care  imagine if your bank account was compromised and they told you that you had to wait an undefined amount of time before they could help you recover it  how does sony get away with this without facing some kind of class action lawsuit  all my digital games are gone because of this supposed  security feature   what can i do  does anyone know how long i have to wait before calling again

text: what s your average review rating prediction for kena: bridge of spirits  i haven t done this on reddit yet and it s pretty popular on facebook so i hope everyone has fun here also   there s not that much gameplay footage for this game yet surprisingly which is fine because we don t want too much spoiled  i ve been interested since the announcement due to the fun looking visuals and intriguing gameplay  however one thing that does concern me is level design which is crucial in my opinion  surprisingly a lot of highly rated games lack in good level design which is a shame that it s looked over by most critics and general reviews  i m obviously aware that we ve seen very little footage however another concern is possible lack of enemy variations  we ve seen too many games flawed this way  personally i feel it s very noticeable in games like god of war  that creates mundane enemy scenarios  we also see games like resident evil  which is a significantly shorter game than god of war  however it s lack of enemy variations is a lot more efficient due to the proper placement and level design which god of war  failed in my opinion  i m pretty sure this game will have collectables and gameplay character progression so there s that dynamic demand  after other tiny observations that would take too much time to explain  i have a rating that seems the most likely and i m basically going by feeling from years of playing video games  i want to state that i want games to be successful and important to gamers  i have no desire to see games fail   i m giving kena: bridge of spirits an average rating prediction of / from critics  i don t predict general reviewers due to mainstream pull and pressure that can affect games that are taking risks or have challenging components that some gamers can t handle  i know that sounds harsh but unfortunately that s our reality and it s real shame   don t take this post too seriously  just have fun and i ll gladly have civil discussions on this topic

text: tails of iron is simply brilliant the art style a little bit reminded me of braid  but it s unique and very colourful too  the story is not as straightforward as you might expect after you start the game  there are few unexpected moments  gameplay and combat are good  you attack  you dodge  you block and parry  all what you would expect from a modern game  and it s also challenging  i died quite a lot during my playthrough  i m not sure about different countries  but it s probably rated + for most of them as the game contains violence and such and it s all well made too  customization options are great and balancing between weight and power was a good addition  i got it full price and finished in  hours and just wanna say - give it a look  it s good  maybe you ll find it interesting too  and yeah  the voice actor who gave his voice to getalt of rivia in the witcher  is a narrator in the game and it makes it approximately % cooler

text: sony s low effort  hubris and the errors of timed exclusivity  let me start by saying that sony has made some of my favorite games recently  god of war  bloodborne  tlou1& and many others  and i think they ve been killing when it comes to first party since the  days  i also think that  they did an excelente job designing the  and it offers great value for a $ machine   seems like every one of their bets paid of     with that said  their value proposition is starting to look pretty bad in comparison to what is out there  seems like sony is set on shameless nickel-and-diming their user base  they spear-headed the new $ new game price and they also are committed to charging an extra $ for  version of games    right now sony has about 125m+ consoles out there and they have 45m+  plus subscriptions at $ a year  charging for something that if we are being honest should be free as it always was on pc  for any storefront and for any game regardless of size   with all that money coming in sony still fails to delivery on basic functionality like access to ///p/v library  can t let that get into the way of re-releasing select games  game history or even their own history be dammed   non-dumb delivery  a decent app or even a functional store website  they even bother to cut  owners from certain  plus games that are also available on  despite the fact they pay the same price for the subscription  they invested early on  now but very half-heartedly and still haven t expanded it to many territories  and don t even allow you to subscribe to download the games if streaming isn t available in your country   the service has a pathetic 3m+ subscribers as of recently    ms seems to be spending a lot of money to get games on gamepass and i can see how that benefits their users that subscribe to the service  sony response to that is to cut exclusivity deals  usually timed  that ultimately don t benefit their own user base at all  those are games that would ve release for  anyway and you still have to pay the same price for them   even the more looked downed upon move by ms  spending $10b+ buying devs and even a entire publisher  still benefits their user base because the games will now end up day  on gamepass   despite the success of the  sony was closing studios during the last  years or so and only started making up for it now  after microsoft started their aggressive spending spree    i m not saying sony should copy gamepass and start putting their games day  there  i wouldn t want that due to how that could affect game quality or the type of games they make   i don t mind paying for good games  that isn t my criticism  but i also don t like to feel like i m being made a fool having to pay a premium for games that are available for much less on other stores or services    i also play on pc so i sort of have access to all these options when trying to find where to play a certain game and so frequently when comparing prices sony value proposition is offensively bad and that s true even for games that many of us would associate with   like many big games published by sega  square and capcom   with sony s games now starting to make their way to pc  this sort of thing starts to matter more for me because it lessens the weight of their main differentiating feature  exclusive games   there is also the problem of jim ryan and how sony under him has adopted the position that misleading marketing and outright lies are fair game  they allowed people to believe for months that certain games were  exclusives when in fact they were crossgen and they now announce games with dates attached to them that they knew very well were not realistic  god of war ragnarok announced as a  game last year for example   that s on top of the terrible communication they had with the community for years

in theory  you don t have to leave your game to do what you want  but it s poorly executed   here s my biggest gripe    the home button  on   press once to go to where ever you were last in the home menu  and double tap  to go directly back into the game  simple and fast  maybe i m just a smooth-brained ape  but i still haven t gotten used to the fact that returning to home screen is a long press and not the single press  again  pressing once to get what you need from the control center is a good idea  but once you leave the game  you have no idea how badly i curse my  because i can t double having a known history amongst other user of poor connectivity and lag spikes throughout every game  is definitely so incredibly disappointing and it makes me uet that i purchased the damn thing text: do not buy the 3d pulse headset  get this: sony recently announced the black 3d pulse headset and for those that plan to buy it  i thought i post this for ppl that are on the edge of getting it but still don t want to spend that much  i had the 3d pulse headset in white and wasn t satisfied with the audio quality  im by no means an audiophile person but the pulse headset has a more dull kind of sound compared to what i got instead:  steelseries arctis  console edition / for  bucks which is half the price of the pulse headset     the sound of them  which still seems ironic to me  is better  use them with linear pcm and youll get crystal clear sound  nothing you d expect with this kind of pricetag  also not only are they very comfortable for me as someone that wears glasses  they are also completely detachable  if a cable breaks down you are able to change it and the ear cushions are also very easy to clean/ replace  since the dualsense controller uses bluetooth   i can tell there is no noticeable delay with the sound at all  i had issues with the pulse headset and it losing connection at one point    just get a  5mm cable that isnt too long and you are good to go   also you don t need to sacrifice your precious usb port for a dongle that way  get this headset and grab a game for the other  bucks ;   or pay for the sony logo and  in my opinion  worse sound  it s up to you
